abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project was
            assessed as deficient. Some of the key operational lessons
            learned include: 1) Particular attention should be paid to
            effective functioning of the multi-sectoral coordination
            institutions and mechanisms during project supervision. 2)
            Up-stream establishment of key procedures and operational
            manuals before project implementation will help to avoid to
            delays and facilitate the establishment of a mutual
            understanding shared by all the actors. 3) A good balance
            between support of reforms and capacities development is
            necessary for successful project implementation. 4)
            Leadership in support of changes is a critical factor for
            project success. 4) Monitoring & evaluation activities
            and follow-up of studies should receive adequate attention.
            5) Programming annual activities requires solid preparation
            and an in-depth review in order to provide a framework for
            smooth implementation of the agreed upon activities.
